Articles.Content: I was wanting to record some video footage and share it here but I must admit I have never really recorded any video games before. I have tried CamStuido but it does not record the game for whatever reason. What video game capture software do you use? Is it free? Thanks.

Only things I\'ve ever found are FRAPS and Bandicam

Both have free versions, and both slap a watermark at the top of their videos.

However, I believe, Fraps limits you to 30 second recordings, whereas Bandicam does not.

I\'ve had some issues with Bandicam causing KSP to crash if you open Bandicam while KSP is currently running, then selecting the KSP window as the one to be recorded.

The obvious solution is just to start Bandicam before you start KSP, and select the KSP window while it\'s loading is all.

I like Camtasia Studio, but it costs. Almost everyone uses Fraps. (Tip: if you record at higher resolution, the watermark is much smaller and almost invisible.) I might just try Bandicam, since I prefer to use and recommend free software whenever possible.

Fraps will work, but it sucks.

MSI Afterburner will work okay, it\'s free, but it can be kind of awkward to use.

Bandicam costs money, but records KSP just great. I love bandicam.

Run ksp in windowed mode and use this

http://www.screencast-o-matic.com/

free, no download needed, and no huge watermark.
